website_summaries.verdict: Gives you immediate feedback on your club head swing speed so you can measure consistency.
pros: Will work anywhere you're practicing your golf swing
You don't even need to be hitting balls to use this tracking tool, it measures the speed of the club head movement through the hitting area
You also can measure the speed of the club head during the back swing to determine consistency
cons: You'll have to manually track the data, as the radar doesn't automatically store it

customer_reviews.title: Wildly Inaccurate and Inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: This product is wildly inaccurate and inconsistent. The first one I bought I exchanged hoping it was just a lemon. The second one I received performed just as poorly. I can verbally count my tempo out better then this can measure, and the speed indicator is all over the map giving random numbers anywhere between 50MPH and 80MPH (7 iron) for identical swings. I set it up exactly as recommended in the owners manual and even try other variations to try and get it to perform accurately. It is totally worthless for its intended purpose. Can't figure out all the positive reviews. Maybe they can market it as a random number generator.
customer_reviews.author: Carlisle

customer_reviews.title: Solid performance and good value.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a total of two bad readings after 1,000+ balls hit. otherwise it is perfectly accurate. People who say it is not either have a faulty unit or a bad and/or unreliable swing. Buying this was the smartest thing I have ever done for my game. It encourages/forces you to try a new approaches/positions etc. in pursuit of higher swing speeds and more rhythmic tempo. I have, no s***, picked up 10 mph in clubhead speed since buying it. I plan on grabbing another 10mph ... at least.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: works great except for a simple flaw
customer_reviews.text: works great except the power on and off button doesn't seem to make contact with the button on the circuit board. solution, I drilled through rubber button to gain access to the button on the circuit board and used a thin object like the drill bit I used to gain access to the circuit board button. Works great now but the avg person would probable get frustrated and return the radar
customer_reviews.author: B. menendez

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a simple training tool to keep track of my swing speeds. I am an avid golfer for 20 years. I measure my swing speeds with other devices as i hit balls on the range with very consistent numbers between 120mph and 130mph. This device will measure between 103 and 119 from swing to swing which seems to be very far off. The lack of accuracy i could deal with but this device seems very inconsistent.
customer_reviews.author: John Dean II

customer_reviews.title: Not worth purchasing
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of positive reviews about this product and how accurate it was. I got to use this and the Trackman at the same time. This product (Sport Sensor) over estimated my swing speed by 5-7 mph per swing. So for me, this was a wasted purchase and I won't be using this product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Auferoth

customer_reviews.title: This swing radar works as described
customer_reviews.text: Good product and works exactly as described. Helps to show the tempo and club head speed that results from changes made in my swing. I have found it effective in showing me the results of making a bigger turn with my shoulders and wider stance. Good value if you are serious about grooving your swing. I have increased my club head speed from 89 mph to 99-100 mph. A difference of close to 20 plus yards with my driver.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: its cool... compact and light. does the job.
customer_reviews.text: seems to work well although i have nothing else to compare it to. ever so often it will miss your swing but it could be me still getting the just of it. i like having the ability to check my swing speed any time. the tempo-timer helps me build consistency, reminding me of how important it is to slow down. funny how counter-intuitive golf can be... swing easier, watch the ball fly just as far and STRAIGHT. overall i do enjoy having it and would recommend it to any friend looking for a similar gadget.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Have now been using this for over 6 months and ...
customer_reviews.text: Have now been using this for over 6 months and it has worked very well. I primarily use it to help me increase and maintain my swing speed. Works well indoors at home as well as on the driving range. As I make slight adjustments to my hands, back swing and tempo I get quick feedback with regard to the impact of these adjustments on my swing speed (which impacts distance). So have improved 10% - 20% depending on each club & continue to seek further improvements.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis R.

customer_reviews.title: I would pass on this one.
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Different numbers all the time. It's hard to tell which one to use. I think I've used it 3x only. It's not worth even pulling out of bag.
customer_reviews.author: desmond moss

customer_reviews.title: cheaply made expensive toy
customer_reviews.text: agree with previous reviews that this is a random number generator. Tried putting it in all different positions to no avail. Cheaply made in China plastic toy. Accidentally dropped it from 3 feet, which did no visible damage but the screen no longer worked. Emailed the company requesting a new screen which probably costs around 3 dollars. No response.
customer_reviews.author: RMAST

customer_reviews.title: I have only had the opportunity to use this device ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only had the opportunity to use this device one time but that one time, as far as I could determine, the Swing Speed Radar worked as advertised. I was able to determine that I need to really increase my driver swing speed by a minimum of 10 - 15 per cent if I expect to hit my drives as far as the professional players do. With that I have been able to embark on a training and practice regimen to try and get my swing speed up a few more miles per hour. 93 mph is not that fast but its a target base line to improve on. The Swing Speed Radar will help accomplish that.
customer_reviews.author: Harold G. Erwin

customer_reviews.title: Swing Speed Radar Assessment
customer_reviews.text: Any golfer who wants to improve his performance needs to know what is the speed of his clubhead and how to increase it ,and therefore augment the distance you carry the ball . When you train on a regular basis with the swing speed radar ,you quickly find outby trial and error what small or infinite changes in your grip, posture ,hip and shoulder rotation tempo ,foot and leg work ,relaxation of body etc..increase the clubhead speed .A must for all keen golfers who want to improve ! Very sturdy and reliable .Another radar ,the ZELOCITY radar , gives in addition the ball speed and the carry of the ball .
customer_reviews.author: Mbwa Kali SanaTop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Accuracy?
customer_reviews.text: Wanted this to be a helpful training aid. It is not. Readings are all over the place and very inconsistent. I seriously doubt my swing speed is going from 50mph to 90mph from swing to swing with the same club. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Accurate enough for casual practice
customer_reviews.text: The swing tempo is helpful and accurate, and swing speed with driver works well too, although positioning can be finicky. But a mixed result with irons. The displayed iron swing speed varies alot when making a divot vs no divot. Looks like it picks up ball speed accidentally sometimes? 30mph difference between identical swings. Anyways, in the end this is the good alternative to spending $$$ on a trackman.
customer_reviews.author: MGI SpeedWare

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate at all!
customer_reviews.text: Gives different reading almost every swing! my Trackman SS is 116 and with this device I have had 130MPH obvious error to as low as 80 mph in the same session so I don't trust what it reads due to this wide gap! Total waste of cash for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: and I've found it very useful as I am trying to increase my golf swing ...
customer_reviews.text: This device works exactly as advertised, and I've found it very useful as I am trying to increase my golf swing speed. Also the customer service is beyond compare. My device quit working, so I sent it in. They couldn't find anything wrong with it but sent me a brand new unit to replace it anyway. I can't recommend this company enough.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Wandrey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I am a little shaky but I did not have to be exactly on the target to get a correct reading. The reticule target has to cross the flag to get an accurate reading. I use it mostly for golf.
customer_reviews.author: Vern Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great for basic speed and tempo work!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy set up and easy to use. Position it in front of your club approximately 10 inches, swing, and it does the rest. It doesn't overwhelm you with info like a trackman analyzer but is great for tempo and speed work. Be careful on the range as it is quite a conversation item and everyone of course things they swing faster than they actually do🙃
customer_reviews.author: Paul Turner

customer_reviews.title: Ease to use
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with this purchase. I works as advertised. I have no way of telling if the readings are correct or not but they do fluctuate when you purposely try to make them change. It is easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Boo Boo

customer_reviews.title: Does what it Advertises
customer_reviews.text: Used it once at driving range, so still getting used to the best way to get value from the product. But it does what it advertises so the product is worth purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Save your $
customer_reviews.text: It should work better for the $ It. Cycles from strokes to slow
customer_reviews.author: Mark P. Costello

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I use it at the approximate 45* angle, not for absolute velocities, but for relative velocities to test different swing methods/ideas.
customer_reviews.author: FredI

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use and setup
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Does exactly what I was looking for it to do, I use the swing speed function primarily haven't really played with the tempo part yet. But super accurate and a cool thing to have to help see what helps to increase club head speed. Person I got it from was awesome! Super fast getting it to me.
customer_reviews.author: gerald zmyslo

customer_reviews.title: Make it invisible
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised, Biggest think is you have to forget it is there. Just swing as usual, then see the speed. Will definitely help with an easy swing translates to faster club head. A good learning tool for that part of you stroke. Not sure how the tempo part really applies except for single club consistency. Would recommend, and can be used with limited flight balls, a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Jomarie Monsorno

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. My husband tried using and it would not work so we returned. I do t recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: JOANNE M.

customer_reviews.title: It's ok for what it's designed for
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as described. It won't correct any of your swing faults. It will let you know exactly how slow your swing speed really is which was what I was curious about. I've since loaned it out to friends who overestimate their swing speeds and are brought down to reality. Now that was worth the money I paid for it!!
customer_reviews.author: Dean K

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I’ve read claims of this being inaccurate but it recorded the same speeds as a FlightScope. Maybe others aren’t setting it up properly.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: Records swing speed badly. Tried it with pro whose speed was recorded by trackman. Inflates mph by 10 to 30 %. Not reproducible swing speeds. Perhaps just a defective item . Returned it which is why I always purchase through Amazon whose return policies are fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Nugent

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Got some wild numbers. Using it at 45 degrees like they say... but I just can't trust the numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Does what is says, and I compared it to a friend’s who had a different model and it was within 1 mph. Pretty happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Wilderotter

customer_reviews.title: So im frustrated as I get different readings.. ...
customer_reviews.text: So im frustrated as I get different readings.... the pro at my club had it at 135 MPH and he is confident this is wrong. Ill swing it at 88 to 95 and then it has me at 116? Ill give it a few more tries but if this continues, Ill return it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt J

customer_reviews.title: Good feedback
customer_reviews.text: Nice to start to have a feedback about your golf speed
customer_reviews.author: Alexandre

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A must have for those working on their swing as it allows immediate feedback.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I little high in price but I need them for my golf instruction.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Brembs

customer_reviews.title: It's not very accurate but will give you an idea ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not very accurate but will give you an idea as to how you can swing smoother yet get faster swing speed. It read my 7 iron at 105 but trackman reads mine at 95
customer_reviews.author: Yuna YJ Pak

customer_reviews.title: Very inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: I shoot around 90 so my game is not great but my swing should be within +/- 5 miles but the radar sometimes reads my 7 iron around 50 miles per hours up to 85 miles per hour. It's just all over the place. Not helpful at all. I'm not sure if it's defective.
customer_reviews.author: Business

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. I had it on my side whenever I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the device that helps improving my swing most. Awesome. I had it on my side whenever I went to the driving range. I knew immediately if the swing was optimal for my own.
customer_reviews.author: C. Tsai

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The radar works well and is worth the price. It has helped my swing and the timer, consistency. The truth is that club speed correlates well with distance, but form is even more important for overall results.
customer_reviews.author: R. Klein

customer_reviews.title: Choose the blue one
customer_reviews.text: Started training with it directly. Took me only a month to increase the swing speed from 82 mph to 94! Tried also with the Tempo Trainer in the beginning but it didn't help me. So there was obviously some money to save wich is the reason to why my rating don't reach five.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and Fun
customer_reviews.text: I have learned my swing speed and use this as a reality check when I try new things. I have also shared it with my golf buddies and it has proved itself to be consistent and fair. One button operation.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S. Cornell

customer_reviews.title: Product works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Product works well and is easy to set up and use. I use for my golf swing speed, and this device gives adequate feedback.
customer_reviews.author: richard johnson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Followed the instructions and watched the you- tube how to. Very inconsistent and inaccurate. Doesn't matter how you tweak positioning of the device. Doesn't deserve 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Mgjim

customer_reviews.title: Just as expected
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine. Must have it pretty close @ 10 inches from tee and angled towards club head approach. Had no idea how much club head speed before. At first my club head speed was 85 mph. After reviewing how to videos, I started using lower body, opening hips before club drives down and my club head speed increased to 95 mph. Don't use the tempo function but very satisfied with the speed radar.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Easy too use
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the price, easy too use. You get fastest feedback ever on your swing. If you aren't real low hcp. you don't need anything else. Next item would be launch monitor ( cost a lot more). You can, if you know how to swing a golf club, learn in less than an 30 min how to speed up the club head even without hitting a golf ball. Works even better when hitting golfballs. You can then see the result of club head speed and effortless swing....
customer_reviews.author: Per Bådholm

customer_reviews.title: NICE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it is supposed to do. You set it 8 inches from your ball and there your swing speed is recorded.
customer_reviews.author: william allison

customer_reviews.title: Easy and accurate
customer_reviews.text: For the money this speed sensor cannot be beat. It is accurate and so easy to use. Now I just have figure out how to get my swing speed above 92 mph.
customer_reviews.author: Therris9

customer_reviews.title: If you want to know? Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a optishot and helps with misreads. Beyond that it's accurate! The only button on it is hard to push.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I like the single cup option so I can use my favorite coffee. I like my own grind better than Keurig. The carafe operates the same as other coffer makers.
customer_reviews.author: Albert J.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little add-on device for fittings
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little add-on device for fittings. I use it extensively to help analyze golf swings in conjunction with a high speed video camera. It gives accurate readings of the swing speed, and helps with shaft flex analyzing with the added tempo timer. Great little product!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan B Wallace

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Got this to check my swing speed, and I am very happy with how the product works. Using the machine I was able to change a couple of things in my set-up, and increased my club head speed by around 10-15%. I don't use the tempo timer, and don't think that is very necessary, but overall I really like the unit. Good training aid.
customer_reviews.author: Texas boy

customer_reviews.title: Sports Swing Speed & Tempo Timer
customer_reviews.text: Does what's advertized. Helps. Use it frequently to confirm what tempo and swing speed constant need to be for good contact for each club
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing gives accurate feedback so you can make improvements to your swing and generate more speed.
customer_reviews.author: average consumer

customer_reviews.title: Very helpfull tool
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, best training tools for golf. I would recomend this to anyone that like to have a consistant swing.
customer_reviews.author: REZA

customer_reviews.title: Make your swing faster
customer_reviews.text: It is great. I don't even have to push the button to reset it. Just swing when ready and it gives you immediate feedback.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Fulco

customer_reviews.title: This is good!
customer_reviews.text: Got this a couple of weeks ago and have already learned how to increase my swing speed. Easily added 20 yards to my drives. Tempo feature has helped get my swing more consistent too. I use it every day when warming up. Try this along with Paul Wilson's training videos (you tube) to amp up your distance.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It works great and helps improve my game. I am completely happy with it. What do you need so many words for?
customer_reviews.author: Debi Manduca

customer_reviews.title: Speed Radar great training aid.
customer_reviews.text: The Sports Sensors Swing Speed Radar is an excellent golf aid for the price. The golf club swing speed is not accurate however. Then again this not a $10,000 launch monitor (like the ones you find at pro shops). I use it to improve my club head speed. I compare my club head speed with variety of swings. Shorter back swings. More or less wrist action. Different weight shifts... etc ... So far I have learned that I need to relax the tension in my arms and wrists; and swinging hard reduces my club head speed. I am practicing to "groove" my swing and develop a more repeatable swing motion.
customer_reviews.author: Wild_Sudoku

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits in my golf bag and easy to use and accurate!
customer_reviews.author: drew rennie

customer_reviews.title: swing speed monitor
customer_reviews.text: When I saw this Swing Sensor Monitor on You Tube I knew it would help me get a higher swing speed and more distance off the tee. When I started my swing was 82-84 MPH. After only 4 trips to the range my speed is consistantly 93-95 MPH. I have added a minium of 25 yards to my drive. My drives now go 210-230 yards. Just take this device to the range and start making adjustments to your swing--- you will see how easy it is. It worked for me and I am 73 years old. I cannot wait to get back to Florida and clean out my golf buddies wallets! R Bowman
customer_reviews.author: richard bowman

customer_reviews.title: Love this. Every golfer would enjoy this golf toy.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I use it on myself, and also with my golfing buddies. Eveybody likes to know their swinng speed and tempo. Very helpful and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Golf Nut

customer_reviews.title: Important tool for anyone seeking improvement in the (golf) game.
customer_reviews.text: Works well in most of the cases, except when you waggle the club. When the club is waggled, it does not record the reading. Has certainly helped me to increase the club swing speed.
customer_reviews.author: Milind

customer_reviews.title: Great for practice
customer_reviews.text: I was able to get my club head speed to 98-108 mph and a good tempo at 1.1 sec. love it.
customer_reviews.author: Quivas

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves the tempo timer
customer_reviews.text: The sports sensor has helped his distance using the tempo timer. He and his friend have added distance to their game.
customer_reviews.author: Debra F. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool for developing your swing speed and to make adjustments to increase it. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Golf radar
customer_reviews.text: My husband found this to be very useful while working on his swing. He took it to a group lesson & everyone wanted to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Excellent Customer service
customer_reviews.text: Great Product, Excellent Customer service! I bought another for my father in law, He is 59 and has picked up several MPH with his golf game.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Parker

customer_reviews.title: fairly accurate and fun to use
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty accurate and has helped me loosen up when practicing my drives. being able to see the tempo and swing speed provides instant feedback that's immensely helpful. I usually bring this with me whenever i go to the range to practice my driver.
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It gave me all the feedback I needed to help me improve my swing.
customer_reviews.author: golfnut

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: If you're wanting to increase your club head speed this is a must buy. By monitoring your club head speed you will intuitively make adjustments to swing faster. Use it on the range to develop your timing while swinging faster. You'll be amazed at how your accuracy and distance will improve. Use it with "Tour Tempo: Golf's Last Secret Finally Revealed" to develop a tour quality swing.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Mason

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful when you want to try new swing techniques to judge if you are gaining swing speed. The tempo timer helps as well.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Savage

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GOLF TOOL
customer_reviews.text: This item really gives the golfer a realistic response to help improve swing tempo and speed. We use it every time we practice.
customer_reviews.author: Mary or John O'Malley

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to golf equipment
customer_reviews.text: It does everything it is supposed to do. Great addition to golf equipment. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.  Great Value.
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate and cost effective. This is a good tool to improve your game and swing speed. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Willett

customer_reviews.title: Swing feedback
customer_reviews.text: This device provides excellent feedback, and a very convincing demonstration that swinging harder does not result in higher swing speed. It works flawlessly as advertized!
customer_reviews.author: John Redmond

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The Swing speed rader was really easy to use. Virtually ready to use right out of the box. I get instant feedback and can moderate my practice to get improved swing speed almost immediately. Anyone struggling to increase his/her swing speed should consider getting this product. Phil
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: This works great!!
customer_reviews.text: This works great!!! The feedback it provides allows you to work on your tempo and determine which tempo works best for you. Knowing your swing speed is nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Customer H

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to know you base line swing speed and ...
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate. Great tool to know you base line swing speed and work on increase your swing speed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best way to improve tempo in your swing
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this SS radar because I wanted to change my driver. So this is a better way to look at my swing speed. Also, by looking at the my tempo, I know exactly how aggressive or smooth I swing the club. Moreover, it is not really that distracting when hitting the ball
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Tr

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: It Works great...its light and easy to store in my carry bag. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MD-MO

customer_reviews.title: Nice play thing!!
customer_reviews.text: Good for temp control. Whish they had a way to store some of the data.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: swing speed sensor
customer_reviews.text: I found the Sport Sensors Swing Speed Radar with Tempo Timer quite helpful. I tried several swing changes and could see a difference.
customer_reviews.author: rksoh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Received sensor in record time and in perfect shape! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Wagner

customer_reviews.title: works great, really helpful if you want to be more ...
customer_reviews.text: works great, really helpful if you want to be more consistent in swing speed, I noticed I was fairly inconsistent right away..
customer_reviews.author: jeremiah j baker

customer_reviews.title: Not sold on the accuracy
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and read. Tempo timer seems to work fine, however curious about accuracy of swing speed. When I swung really really hard it barely read 75mph. I'm no tour player in his 20s (I'm 54), but I find it hard to believe that my regular swing is that slow. There is a chart that comes with the unit that approximates relationship of driver swing speed and ball distance. I normally carry my driver a little over 200, which corresponds with a 95mph swing speed. A 75mph swing speed translates into a 140 yard drive. So I'm a bit skeptical. Very likely will return it.
customer_reviews.author: tina messina

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It worked as advertised, buy I returned because once I determined my swing speed I couldn't really improve it.
customer_reviews.author: D.P.O.

customer_reviews.title: Sport Sensor Swing Speed Radar
customer_reviews.text: Absolute piece of junk. Tested the device numerous times using Driver, 6 iron in my garage setup with the Net Return. Multiple adjustments to register proper readings, and no matter the club or speed of my swing, the SS radar registered no more than 79mph. Do not waste your money on this !!! Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Jaggie99

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This product did not capture the correct speed of my golf swing. I had the same MPH no matter how hard I swung my club.
customer_reviews.author: RocMomma

customer_reviews.title: What!  No batteries!
customer_reviews.text: OK, I am pretty easy to please but when you pay quite a lot of money for an item and they are too cheap to include the batteries, I will start them out with the rating of three stars! Maybe I will revise after I actually try the product
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Woodward

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Wire bale is not included! Difficult to put on the ground
customer_reviews.author: AN SONG SOO

product_meta.title: Sports Sensors Swing Speed Radar with Tempo Timer
feature_bullets: Measures clubhead swing speed and tempo time to help golfers optimize their swing to increase distance and improve swing consistency
Range of speed measurement from 40 MPH to over 200 MPH
Actual swing Tempo Time, from the start of the club takeaway to ball impact is measured to one hundredth of a second
Use it at home in the backyard, indoors or outdoors in a hitting cage, at the driving range

No need to hit an actual golf ball—use a wiffle ball, Birdie Ball, sponge ball or equivalent to simulate a real ball, but swing at a ball replica to release the club properly.Immediate feedback provides a basis for golfers to determine swing improvements

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
